titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Project Brav New World Records
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Images of the banners featuring Bravman's face that were unfurled in various campus locations, stickers that were distributed on campus, copies of email among the student artists, and clippings on the event.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Project Brav New World Records (SCM0276). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Project Brav New World was performance artwork done by a group of Stanford students (associated with the Matthias K. Rath Museum of Destruction and Resurrection in the Kairos dorm) who attempted to create an overnight Cult of Personality centered on John C. Bravman, Vice Provost for Undergraduate Education.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Images of the banners featuring Bravman's face that were unfurled in various campus locations, stickers that were distributed on campus, copies of email among the student artists, and clippings on the event.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The Stanford University Archives also holds one of the banners and two t-shirts from this event in the Archives Museum Collection.
